result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E. Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Child Pornography, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Michael E. Walker in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that all parties have received a copy of the PSI.  Atty Gumz did receive a copy and also a copy of the evaluation.
Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
J.S. makes a statement to the court.
A.S. makes a statement to the court.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Court orders 6 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 3 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
Report forthwith
Court Costs = $268.00
DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
Comply with Sex Offender Registry
Comply with and complete any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
bond be applied; balance to be paid while on extended supervision
Payment of Court obligations and Supervision Fees
No contact with minors unless approved by probation agent
Participation and completion of a Sex Offender Assessment and treatment deemed appropriate
Participation and completion of an Alcohol and Drug Assessment and any treatment deemed appropriate
Participation and completion of any other counseling deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and
agent.
Surcharge $500.00 x 2 for images

  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 21, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Michael E. Walker in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM10 tracking:
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to 15CF4.  15CM10 to be dismissed and read-in.  Atty Hendee is asking that a PSI be ordered.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.f  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CF4.  15CM10 to be dismissed and read-in.
PSI ordered.
Set for Sentencing
bond continued

Defendant Michael E. Walker in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

*No unsupervised contact with any juvenile under the age of 10
*No contact with Ashley Kollaszar
*Appear for booking today
